title: Honored Puerto Rican Army Unit Made A Name For Itself In Korean War
teaser: The Army's 65th Infantry Regiment was a segregated military unit, begun in 1899 and composed of Puerto Ricans. President Barack Obama is signing a bill to honor the unit with one of the highest civilian honors, the Congressional Gold Medal.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
